net.viktorc.pp4j.impl

Class SimpleProcessManager

  • Object
    • AbstractProcessManager
      • SimpleProcessManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProcessManager

    public class SimpleProcessManager
extends AbstractProcessManager
    A simple sub-class of the AbstractProcessManager abstract class. It assumes that the process is immediately started up as soon as it is launched (without having to wait for a certain output denoting that the process is ready), it has the process forcibly killed every time it needs to be terminated due to timing out or not being reusable, and it implements no callback for when the process terminates.
    Author:
    Viktor Csomor

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleProcessManager

        public SimpleProcessManager(ProcessBuilder builder,
                            long keepAliveTime,
                            Consumer<ProcessExecutor> onStartup)
        Constructs a manager for the processes created by the specified ProcessBuilder with the specified maximum life span.
        Parameters:
        builder - The instance to build the processes with.
        keepAliveTime - The number of milliseconds after which idle processes are terminated. If it is 0 or less, the life span of the process will not be limited.
        onStartup - A consumer that is called after the process started up to allow for the execution of commands to 'prepare' the process for the pool. If it is null, no preprocessing is performed.

      • SimpleProcessManager

        public SimpleProcessManager(ProcessBuilder builder,
                            long keepAliveTime)
        Constructs a manager for the processes created by the specified ProcessBuilder with the specified maximum life span.
        Parameters:

        keepAliveTime - The number of milliseconds after which idle processes are terminated. If it is 0 or less, the life span of the process will not be limited.

    • Method Detail

      • startsUpInstantly

        public boolean startsUpInstantly()
        Description copied from interface: ProcessManager
        A method that denotes whether the process should be considered started up instantly or if it is only started up once a certain output has been printed to its standard out or standard error streams. If it returns true, the process is instantly considered started up and ready as soon as it is running, and the method ProcessManager.onStartup(ProcessExecutor) is executed. If it returns false, the method ProcessManager.isStartedUp(String, boolean) determines when the process is considered started up.
        Returns:
        Whether the process instantly start up as soon as it is run or if it is started up and ready only when a certain output has been written to one of its output streams.

      • isStartedUp

        public boolean isStartedUp(String outputLine,
                           boolean standard)
        Description copied from interface: ProcessManager
        Handles the output of the underlying process after it has been started. The return value of the method determines whether the process is to be considered started up and ready for the execution of the method ProcessManager.onStartup(ProcessExecutor). It is only ever called if ProcessManager.startsUpInstantly() returns false.
        Parameters:
        outputLine - A line of output produced by the process.
        standard - Whether this line has been output to the standard out or the standard error stream.
        Returns:
        Whether the process is to be considered started up.

      • onStartup

        public void onStartup(ProcessExecutor executor)
        Description copied from interface: ProcessManager
        A method called right after the process is started. Its main purpose is to allow for startup activities such as the execution of commands. The executor should be available and ready for processing submissions within this call back, thus its ProcessExecutor.execute(Submission) method should always return true unless the process is terminated before executor could finish processing the submission.
        Parameters:
        executor - The ProcessExecutor instance in which the process is executed. It serves as a handle for sending commands to the underlying process after the startup if needed.
